page.title: 10THE GROUNDS OF UPTON HOUSE
page.content: {A day in the grounds of Upton House Sitting by the pond, I can see the house standing big and tall in the grounds of the park. It stands grand and elegant with its hard stone walls, mellow in the afternoon sunlight. The ducks on the pond - tail up, head down, eating weeds off the bottom, the pond murky brown but a light green when illuminated by shafts of sunlight spearing through the trees above. The light breeze disturbs the stillness of the leaves but carries the cry of peacocks proudly strolling with fan like tails outspread, giving a brilliant display of colour. These are my impressions of Upton Country Park on a May afternoon in 1985.
